title: Ground frost in Nuwara-Eliya, misty conditions in western province
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island today (13).

title: Another registered criminal repatriated from India
byline: A notorious underworld figure, Mandalagala Bombugalage Sumith Priyantha, has been extradited to Sri Lanka following a high-level operation led by the Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP).

title: Sri Lanka’s Hambantota Port and Sinopec enhance maritime fuel supply with HSFO storage
byline: Sri Lanka’s China-backed Hambantota Port and Sinopec have announced the addition of High Sulphur Fuel Oil (HSFO) to their range of ship fuels.

title: Final decision on further power cuts expected today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that the final decision on whether any further power cuts will be implemented or not, will be announced today (13).

title: UN rights office estimates up to 1,400 killed in crackdown on protests in Bangladesh
byline: The United Nations human rights office on Wednesday estimated that up to 1,400 people may have been killed in Bangladesh over three weeks last summer in a crackdown on student-led protests against the now-ousted former prime minister.

title: Island-wide power cuts to continue today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) announced that island-wide power interruptions will be implemented today (13) as well.

title: President Anura Kumara returns from UAE
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has returned to the island this morning after concluding his three-day visit to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and attending the World Government Summit 2025.

title: Power cut schedule for today
byline: A one-hour power cut will be imposed in different zones under 04 categories between 5.00 p.m. and 9.30 p.m. today (13), the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) announced.

title: Budget expectations: Tourism sector urges reasonable duty concessions on vehicle imports
byline: The Chairman of the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA), Buddhika Hewawasam says that the government must focus on enhancing air connectivity to the nation in order to achieve its long-term tourism targets by 2030.

title: Cat “hijacks” RyanAir flight to Germany, causing 2-day delay
byline: A Ryanair flight from Rome to Germany was grounded for two days after a cat was discovered onboard.

title: Sri Lanka, UAE sign agreement to strengthen economic and investment relations
byline: Coinciding with the President’s three-day official visit to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to attend the World Governments Summit 2025, Sri Lanka and the UAE reached an agreement on Reciprocal Promotion and Protection of Investments to strengthen economic and investment relations between the two countries.

title: CID concludes money-laundering probe against Namal Rajapaksa, awaits AG’s advise
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (13) that it has taken steps to seek the Attorney General’s advice regarding legal action against a group of suspects, including Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa, over the charges of money laundering.

title: Adani Group withdraws from Sri Lanka wind project, citing delays
byline: Adani Green Energy, part of Indian billionaire Gautam Adani’s Adani Group, has decided to withdraw from its wind energy project in Mannar, Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowances to be credited today
byline: The Welfare Benefits Board has announced that the “Aswesuma” welfare benefit allowances for this month will be credited to the beneficiary bank accounts today (13).

title: AG withdraws recommendation on Lasantha murder suspects
byline: The Attorney General has informed the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s that the recent recommendation made by him regarding the suspects involved in the murder of Sri Lankan journalist Lasantha Wickrematunge will be suspended temporarily.

title: Sri Lanka’s women MPs push for amendments to boost female representation in elections
byline: A meeting to discuss the Action Plan of the Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus was held on recently under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and the Chairperson of the Caucus, Minister of Women and Child Affairs Saroja Savitri Paulraj.

title: Gas explosion at Taiwan food court kills 4 and leaves 8 hospitalized
byline: A gas explosion at a department store in Taiwan on Thursday killed four people and left eight hospitalized, fire authorities said.

title: Adani Green Energy shares surge 3% amidst withdrawal from Sri Lanka project - report
byline: Adani Green Energy shares surged 3% to INR 946 in Thursday’s intraday trade on BSE following the announcement that the company is withdrawing from its proposed wind power generation and transmission project in Sri Lanka, easing concerns over the project’s viability, Indian media reported.

title: Carmakers Nissan and Honda call off merger talks
byline: Japan’s Nissan and Honda have ended discussions on a deal that would have created the world’s third-largest carmaker.

title: Sri Lanka’s LG elections between April 20-30?
byline: The Supreme Court’s determination on the petitions filed against the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill is expected to be presented in Parliament tomorrow (14), during a special Parliamentary sitting.

title: Police Spokesman assures action over MP Archchuna’s assault incident
byline: Sri Lanka Police Spokesperson SSP Buddhika Manathunga states that legal action will be initiated against Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna in connection with the recent assault incident.

title: Over 250 foreigners including Sri Lankan freed from Myanmar’s scam centres
byline: More than 250 people from 20 nationalities, including a Sri Lankan national, who had been working in telecom fraud centres in Myanmar’s Karen State have been released by an ethnic armed group and brought to Thailand, the BBC reported.

title: Water supply to security quarters at Mahinda’s Wijerama residence disconnected
byline: The water supply to the section of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s residence at Wijerama in Colombo 07, where the accommodation for security personnel is located, has been disconnected due to non-payment of outstanding bills amounting to around Rs. 300,000.

title: Driver plows into crowd in Munich, injuring at least 28 in ‘suspected attack’
byline: A driver drove a car into a union demonstration in central Munich on Thursday, injuring at least 28 people including children, authorities said. Authorities said it was believed to be an attack, and the suspect — an Afghan asylum-seeker — was arrested.

title: Massive fire at factory in Boralugoda BOI zone
byline: A massive fire has broken out at a factory located within the BOI industrial zone in Boralugoda, Horana.

title: Four cops arrested over suspect’s death in Wadduwa granted bail
byline: Four Police Constables (PCs) attached to the Wadduwa Police Station have been granted bail after being arrested for allegedly assaulting a person who had been apprehended by Wadduwa Police and later died following his release from custody.

title: Ex-Sri Lankan MP arrested in fake passport case, lodged in Indian jail
byline: A former member of the Sri Lankan parliament from a leading Tamil party was arrested by the ‘Q Branch’ of the Tamil Nadu Police for allegedly obtaining an Indian passport using fake address proof documents, Indian media reported today.

title: Preliminary discussion on finalizing Budget 2025 held under President’s patronage
byline: A preliminary discussion on the final phase of drafting the Budget 2025, which is scheduled to be presented to Parliament on February 17, was held this afternoon (13) at the Presidential Secretariat under the leadership of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).
